Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/sub1sp.c

1/* mpfr_sub1sp -- internal function to perform a "real" subtraction
2 All the op must have the same precision
3
4Copyright 2003-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
5Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
6
7This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
8
9The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
10it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
11the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
12option) any later version.
13
14The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
15WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
16or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
17License for more details.
18
19You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
20along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
21http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2251 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
23
24#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
25#include "mpfr-impl.h"
26
27/* Check if we have to check the result of mpfr_sub1sp with mpfr_sub1 */
28#if MPFR_WANT_ASSERT >= 2
29
30int mpfr_sub1sp_ref (mpfr_ptr, mpfr_srcptr, mpfr_srcptr, mpfr_rnd_t);
31int mpfr_sub1sp (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
32{
33 mpfr_t tmpa, tmpb, tmpc;
34 mpfr_flags_t old_flags, flags, flags2;
35 int inexb, inexc, inexact, inexact2;
36
37 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
38 return mpfr_sub1sp_ref (a, b, c, rnd_mode);
39
40 old_flags = __gmpfr_flags;
41
42 mpfr_init2 (tmpa, MPFR_PREC (a));
43 mpfr_init2 (tmpb, MPFR_PREC (b));
44 mpfr_init2 (tmpc, MPFR_PREC (c));
45
46 inexb = mpfr_set (tmpb, b, MPFR_RNDN);
47 MPFR_ASSERTN (inexb == 0);
48
49 inexc = mpfr_set (tmpc, c, MPFR_RNDN);
50 MPFR_ASSERTN (inexc == 0);
51
52 MPFR_ASSERTN (__gmpfr_flags == old_flags);
53
54 inexact2 = mpfr_sub1 (tmpa, tmpb, tmpc, rnd_mode);
55 flags2 = __gmpfr_flags;
56
57 __gmpfr_flags = old_flags;
58 inexact = mpfr_sub1sp_ref (a, b, c, rnd_mode);
59 flags = __gmpfr_flags;
60
61 if (! mpfr_equal_p (tmpa, a) || inexact != inexact2 || flags != flags2)
62 {
63 fprintf (stderr, "sub1 & sub1sp return different values for %s\n"
64 "Prec_a = %lu, Prec_b = %lu, Prec_c = %lu\nB = ",
65 mpfr_print_rnd_mode (rnd_mode),
66 (unsigned long) MPFR_PREC (a),
67 (unsigned long) MPFR_PREC (b),
68 (unsigned long) MPFR_PREC (c));
69 mpfr_fdump (stderr, tmpb);
70 fprintf (stderr, "C = ");
71 mpfr_fdump (stderr, tmpc);
72 fprintf (stderr, "sub1 : ");
73 mpfr_fdump (stderr, tmpa);
74 fprintf (stderr, "sub1sp: ");
75 mpfr_fdump (stderr, a);
76 fprintf (stderr, "Inexact sp = %d | Inexact = %d\n"
77 "Flags sp = %u | Flags = %u\n",
78 inexact, inexact2, flags, flags2);
79 MPFR_ASSERTN (0);
80 }
81 mpfr_clears (tmpa, tmpb, tmpc, (mpfr_ptr) 0);
82 return inexact;
83}
84# define mpfr_sub1sp mpfr_sub1sp_ref
85#endif /* MPFR_WANT_ASSERT >= 2 */
86
87#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI)
88
89/* special code for p < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
90static int
91mpfr_sub1sp1 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode,
92 mpfr_prec_t p)
93{
94 mpfr_exp_t bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
95 mpfr_exp_t cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
96 mp_limb_t *ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
97 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
98 mp_limb_t *cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
99 mpfr_prec_t cnt, INITIALIZED(sh);
100 mp_limb_t rb; /* round bit */
101 mp_limb_t sb; /* sticky bit */
102 mp_limb_t a0;
103 mp_limb_t mask;
104 mpfr_uexp_t d;
105
106 MPFR_ASSERTD(p < GMP_NUMB_BITS);
107
108 if (bx == cx)
109 {
110 a0 = bp[0] - cp[0];
111 if (a0 == 0) /* result is zero */
112 {
113 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD)
114 MPFR_SET_NEG(a);
115 else
116 MPFR_SET_POS(a);
117 MPFR_SET_ZERO(a);
118 MPFR_RET (0);
119 }
120 else if (a0 > bp[0]) /* borrow: |c| > |b| */
121 {
122 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a, b);
123 a0 = -a0;
124 }
125 else /* bp[0] > cp[0] */
126 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
127
128 /* now a0 != 0 */
129 MPFR_ASSERTD(a0 != 0);
130 count_leading_zeros (cnt, a0);
131 ap[0] = a0 << cnt;
132 bx -= cnt;
133 rb = sb = 0;
134 /* Note: sh is not initialized, but will not be used in this case. */
135 }
136 else if (bx > cx)
137 {
138 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
139 BGreater1:
140 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
141 sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
142 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
143 if (d < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
144 {
145 sb = - (cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)); /* neglected part of -c */
146 /* Note that "a0 = bp[0] - (cp[0] >> d) - (sb != 0);" is faster
147 on some other machines and has no immediate dependencies for
148 the first subtraction. In the future, make sure that the code
149 is recognized as a *single* subtraction with borrow and/or use
150 a builtin when available (currently provided by Clang, but not
151 by GCC); create a new macro for that. See the TODO later.
152 Note also that with Clang, the constant 0 for the first
153 subtraction instead of a variable breaks the optimization:
154 https://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=31754 */
155 a0 = bp[0] - (sb != 0) - (cp[0] >> d);
156 /* a0 cannot be zero here since:
157 a) if d >= 2, then a0 >= 2^(w-1) - (2^(w-2)-1) with
158 w = GMP_NUMB_BITS, thus a0 - 1 >= 2^(w-2),
159 b) if d = 1, then since p < GMP_NUMB_BITS we have sb=0.
160 */
161 MPFR_ASSERTD(a0 > 0);
162 count_leading_zeros (cnt, a0);
163 if (cnt)
164 a0 = (a0 << cnt) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
165 sb <<= cnt;
166 bx -= cnt;
167 /* sh > 0 since p < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
168 MPFR_ASSERTD(sh > 0);
169 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
170 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
171 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
172 }
173 else /* d >= GMP_NUMB_BITS */
174 {
175 if (bp[0] > MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
176 {
177 /* We compute b - ulp(b), and the remainder ulp(b) - c satisfies:
178 1/2 ulp(b) < ulp(b) - c < ulp(b), thus rb = sb = 1. */
179 ap[0] = bp[0] - (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh);
180 rb = 1;
181 }
182 else
183 {
184 /* Warning: since we have an exponent decrease, when
185 p = GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1 and d = GMP_NUMB_BITS, the round bit
186 corresponds to the upper bit of -c. In that case rb = 0 and
187 sb = 1, except when c0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT where rb = 1 and
188 sb = 0. */
189 rb = sh > 1 || d > GMP_NUMB_BITS || cp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
190 /* sb=1 below is incorrect when p = GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1,
191 d = GMP_NUMB_BITS and c0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT, but in
192 that case the even rule wound round up too. */
193 ap[0] = ~mask;
194 bx --;
195 /* Warning: if d = GMP_NUMB_BITS and c0 = 1000...000, then
196 b0 - c0 = |0111...111|1000...000|, which after the shift
197 becomes |111...111|000...000| thus if p = GMP_NUMB_BITS-1
198 we have rb = 1 but sb = 0. However in this case the round
199 even rule will round up, which is what we get with sb = 1:
200 the final result will be correct, while sb is incorrect. */
201 }
202 sb = 1;
203 }
204 }
205 else /* cx > bx */
206 {
207 mpfr_exp_t tx;
208 mp_limb_t *tp;
209 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
210 tp = bp; bp = cp; cp = tp;
211 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a, b);
212 goto BGreater1;
213 }
214
215 /* now perform rounding */
216
217 /* Warning: MPFR considers underflow *after* rounding with an unbounded
218 exponent range. However since b and c have same precision p, they are
219 multiples of 2^(emin-p), likewise for b-c. Thus if bx < emin, the
220 subtraction (with an unbounded exponent range) is exact, so that bx is
221 also the exponent after rounding with an unbounded exponent range. */
222 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx < __gmpfr_emin))
223 {
224 /* For RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |a| <= 2^(emin-2)
225 we have to change to RNDZ. This corresponds to:
226 (a) either bx < emin - 1
227 (b) or bx = emin - 1 and ap[0] = 1000....000 (in this case necessarily
228 rb = sb = 0 since b-c is multiple of 2^(emin-p) */
229 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
230 (bx < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || ap[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
231 {
232 MPFR_ASSERTD(rb == 0 && sb == 0);
233 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
234 }
235 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
236 }
237
238 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
239 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
240 MPFR_RET (0);
241 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
242 {
243 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
244 goto truncate;
245 else
246 goto add_one_ulp;
247 }
248 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
249 {
250 truncate:
251 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(a));
252 }
253 else /* round away from zero */
254 {
255 add_one_ulp:
256 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
257 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[0] == 0))
258 {
259 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
260 /* Note: bx+1 cannot exceed __gmpfr_emax, since |a| <= |b|, thus
261 bx+1 is at most equal to the original exponent of b. */
262 MPFR_ASSERTD(bx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
263 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx + 1);
264 }
265 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(a));
266 }
267}
268
269/* special code for p = GMP_NUMB_BITS */
270static int
271mpfr_sub1sp1n (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
272{
273 mpfr_exp_t bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
274 mpfr_exp_t cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
275 mp_limb_t *ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
276 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
277 mp_limb_t *cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
278 mpfr_prec_t cnt;
279 mp_limb_t rb; /* round bit */
280 mp_limb_t sb; /* sticky bit */
281 mp_limb_t a0;
282 mpfr_uexp_t d;
283
284 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(a) == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
285 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(b) == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
286 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(c) == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
287
288 if (bx == cx)
289 {
290 a0 = bp[0] - cp[0];
291 if (a0 == 0) /* result is zero */
292 {
293 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD)
294 MPFR_SET_NEG(a);
295 else
296 MPFR_SET_POS(a);
297 MPFR_SET_ZERO(a);
298 MPFR_RET (0);
299 }
300 else if (a0 > bp[0]) /* borrow: |c| > |b| */
301 {
302 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a, b);
303 a0 = -a0;
304 }
305 else /* bp[0] > cp[0] */
306 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
307
308 /* now a0 != 0 */
309 MPFR_ASSERTD(a0 != 0);
310 count_leading_zeros (cnt, a0);
311 ap[0] = a0 << cnt;
312 bx -= cnt;
313 rb = sb = 0;
314 }
315 else if (bx > cx)
316 {
317 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
318 BGreater1:
319 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
320 if (d < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
321 {
322 sb = - (cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)); /* neglected part of -c */
323 a0 = bp[0] - (sb != 0) - (cp[0] >> d);
324 /* a0 can only be zero when d=1, b0 = B/2, and c0 = B-1, where
325 B = 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS, thus b0 - c0/2 = 1/2 */
326 if (a0 == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
327 {
328 bx -= GMP_NUMB_BITS;
329 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
330 rb = sb = 0;
331 }
332 else
333 {
334 count_leading_zeros (cnt, a0);
335 if (cnt)
336 a0 = (a0 << cnt) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
337 sb <<= cnt;
338 bx -= cnt;
339 rb = sb & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
340 sb &= ~MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
341 ap[0] = a0;
342 }
343 }
344 else /* d >= GMP_NUMB_BITS */
345 {
346 /* We compute b - ulp(b) */
347 if (bp[0] > MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
348 {
349 /* If d = GMP_NUMB_BITS, rb = 0 and sb = 1,
350 unless c0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT in which case rb = 1 and sb = 0.
351 If d > GMP_NUMB_BITS, rb = sb = 1. */
352 rb = d > GMP_NUMB_BITS || cp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
353 sb = d > GMP_NUMB_BITS || cp[0] != MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
354 ap[0] = bp[0] - MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
355 }
356 else
357 {
358 /* Warning: in this case a0 is shifted by one!
359 If d=GMP_NUMB_BITS:
360 (a) if c0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT, a0 = 111...111, rb = sb = 0
361 (b) otherwise, a0 = 111...110, rb = -c0 >= 01000...000,
362 sb = (-c0) << 2
363 If d=GMP_NUMB_BITS+1: a0 = 111...111
364 (c) if c0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT, rb = 1 and sb = 0
365 (d) otherwise rb = 0 and sb = 1
366 If d > GMP_NUMB_BITS+1:
367 (e) a0 = 111...111, rb = sb = 1
368 */
369 bx --;
370 if (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS && cp[0] > MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
371 { /* case (b) */
372 rb = (-cp[0]) >= (MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT >> 1);
373 sb = (-cp[0]) << 2;
374 ap[0] = -(MPFR_LIMB_ONE << 1);
375 }
376 else /* cases (a), (c), (d) and (e) */
377 {
378 ap[0] = -MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
379 /* rb=1 in case (e) and case (c) */
380 rb = d > GMP_NUMB_BITS + 1
381 || (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS + 1 && cp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT);
382 /* sb = 1 in case (d) and (e) */
383 sb = d > GMP_NUMB_BITS + 1
384 || (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS + 1 && cp[0] > MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT);
385 }
386 }
387 }
388 }
389 else /* cx > bx */
390 {
391 mpfr_exp_t tx;
392 mp_limb_t *tp;
393 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
394 tp = bp; bp = cp; cp = tp;
395 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a, b);
396 goto BGreater1;
397 }
398
399 /* now perform rounding */
400
401 /* Warning: MPFR considers underflow *after* rounding with an unbounded
402 exponent range. However since b and c have same precision p, they are
403 multiples of 2^(emin-p), likewise for b-c. Thus if bx < emin, the
404 subtraction (with an unbounded exponent range) is exact, so that bx is
405 also the exponent after rounding with an unbounded exponent range. */
406 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx < __gmpfr_emin))
407 {
408 /* For RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |a| <= 2^(emin-2)
409 we have to change to RNDZ. This corresponds to:
410 (a) either bx < emin - 1
411 (b) or bx = emin - 1 and ap[0] = 1000....000 (in this case necessarily
412 rb = sb = 0 since b-c is multiple of 2^(emin-p) */
413 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
414 (bx < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || ap[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
415 {
416 MPFR_ASSERTD(rb == 0 && sb == 0);
417 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
418 }
419 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
420 }
421
422 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
423 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
424 MPFR_RET (0);
425 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
426 {
427 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & MPFR_LIMB_ONE) == 0))
428 goto truncate;
429 else
430 goto add_one_ulp;
431 }
432 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
433 {
434 truncate:
435 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(a));
436 }
437 else /* round away from zero */
438 {
439 add_one_ulp:
440 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
441 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[0] == 0))
442 {
443 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
444 /* Note: bx+1 cannot exceed __gmpfr_emax, since |a| <= |b|, thus
445 bx+1 is at most equal to the original exponent of b. */
446 MPFR_ASSERTD(bx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
447 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx + 1);
448 }
449 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(a));
450 }
451}
452
453/* special code for GMP_NUMB_BITS < p < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
454static int
455mpfr_sub1sp2 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode,
456 mpfr_prec_t p)
457{
458 mpfr_exp_t bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
459 mpfr_exp_t cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
460 mp_limb_t *ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
461 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
462 mp_limb_t *cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
463 mpfr_prec_t cnt, INITIALIZED(sh);
464 mp_limb_t rb; /* round bit */
465 mp_limb_t sb; /* sticky bit */
466 mp_limb_t mask, a0, a1;
467 mpfr_uexp_t d;
468
469 MPFR_ASSERTD(GMP_NUMB_BITS < p && p < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS);
470
471 if (bx == cx) /* subtraction is exact in this case */
472 {
473 /* first compute a0: if the compiler is smart enough, it will use the generated
474 borrow to get for free the term (bp[0] < cp[0]) */
475 a0 = bp[0] - cp[0];
476 a1 = bp[1] - cp[1] - (bp[0] < cp[0]);
477 if (a1 == 0 && a0 == 0) /* result is zero */
478 {
479 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD)
480 MPFR_SET_NEG(a);
481 else
482 MPFR_SET_POS(a);
483 MPFR_SET_ZERO(a);
484 MPFR_RET (0);
485 }
486 else if (a1 >= bp[1]) /* borrow: |c| > |b| */
487 {
488 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a, b);
489 /* a = b-c mod 2^(2*GMP_NUMB_BITS) */
490 a0 = -a0;
491 a1 = -a1 - (a0 != 0);
492 }
493 else /* bp[0] > cp[0] */
494 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
495
496 if (a1 == 0)
497 {
498 a1 = a0;
499 a0 = 0;
500 bx -= GMP_NUMB_BITS;
501 }
502
503 /* now a1 != 0 */
504 MPFR_ASSERTD(a1 != 0);
505 count_leading_zeros (cnt, a1);
506 if (cnt)
507 {
508 ap[1] = (a1 << cnt) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
509 ap[0] = a0 << cnt;
510 bx -= cnt;
511 }
512 else
513 {
514 ap[1] = a1;
515 ap[0] = a0;
516 }
517 rb = sb = 0;
518 /* Note: sh is not initialized, but will not be used in this case. */
519 }
520 else if (bx > cx)
521 {
522 mp_limb_t t;
523
524 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
525 BGreater2:
526 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
527 sh = 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
528 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
529 if (d < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
530 {
531 t = (cp[1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | (cp[0] >> d);
532 /* TODO: Change the code to generate a full subtraction with borrow,
533 avoiding the test on sb and the corresponding correction. Note
534 that Clang has builtins:
535 http://clang.llvm.org/docs/LanguageExtensions.html#multiprecision-arithmetic-builtins
536 but the generated code may not be good:
537 https://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=20748
538 With the current source code, Clang generates on x86_64:
539 1. sub %rsi,%rbx for the first subtraction in a1;
540 2. sub %rdi,%rax for the subtraction in a0;
541 3. sbb $0x0,%rbx for the second subtraction in a1, i.e. just
542 subtracting the borrow out from (2).
543 So, Clang recognizes the borrow, but doesn't merge (1) and (3).
544 Bug: https://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=25858
545 For GCC: https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=79173
546 */
547#ifndef MPFR_FULLSUB
548 a0 = bp[0] - t;
549 a1 = bp[1] - (cp[1] >> d) - (bp[0] < t);
550 sb = cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d); /* neglected part of c */
551 if (sb)
552 {
553 a1 -= (a0 == 0);
554 a0 --;
555 /* a = a1,a0 cannot become zero here, since:
556 a) if d >= 2, then a1 >= 2^(w-1) - (2^(w-2)-1) with
557 w = GMP_NUMB_BITS, thus a1 - 1 >= 2^(w-2),
558 b) if d = 1, then since p < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS we have sb=0. */
559 MPFR_ASSERTD(a1 > 0 || a0 > 0);
560 sb = -sb; /* 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS - sb */
561 }
562#else
563 sb = - (cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d));
564 a0 = bp[0] - t - (sb != 0);
565 a1 = bp[1] - (cp[1] >> d) - (bp[0] < t || (bp[0] == t && sb != 0));
566#endif
567 if (a1 == 0)
568 {
569 /* this implies d=1, which in turn implies sb=0 */
570 MPFR_ASSERTD(sb == 0);
571 a1 = a0;
572 a0 = 0; /* should be a0 = sb */
573 /* since sb=0 already, no need to set it to 0 */
574 bx -= GMP_NUMB_BITS;
575 }
576 /* now a1 != 0 */
577 MPFR_ASSERTD(a1 != 0);
578 count_leading_zeros (cnt, a1);
579 if (cnt)
580 {
581 ap[1] = (a1 << cnt) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
582 a0 = (a0 << cnt) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
583 sb <<= cnt;
584 bx -= cnt;
585 }
586 else
587 ap[1] = a1;
588 /* sh > 0 since p < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
589 MPFR_ASSERTD(sh > 0);
590 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
591 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
592 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
593 }
594 else if (d < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
595 { /* GMP_NUMB_BITS <= d < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
596 /* warning: the most significant bit of sb might become the least
597 significant bit of a0 below */
598 sb = (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS) ? cp[0]
599 : (cp[1] << (2*GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | (cp[0] != 0);
600 t = (cp[1] >> (d - GMP_NUMB_BITS)) + (sb != 0);
601 /* warning: t might overflow to 0 if d=GMP_NUMB_BITS and sb <> 0 */
602 a0 = bp[0] - t;
603 a1 = bp[1] - (bp[0] < t) - (t == 0 && sb != 0);
604 sb = -sb;
605 /* since bp[1] has its most significant bit set, we can have an
606 exponent decrease of at most one */
607 if (a1 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
608 {
609 ap[1] = (a1 << 1) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
610 a0 = (a0 << 1) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
611 sb <<= 1;
612 bx --;
613 }
614 else
615 ap[1] = a1;
616 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
617 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
618 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
619 }
620 else /* d >= 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
621 {
622 /* We compute b - ulp(b), and the remainder ulp(b) - c satisfies:
623 1/2 ulp(b) < ulp(b) - c < ulp(b), thus rb = sb = 1, unless we
624 had an exponent decrease. */
625 t = MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
626 a0 = bp[0] - t;
627 a1 = bp[1] - (bp[0] < t);
628 if (a1 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
629 {
630 /* necessarily we had b = 1000...000 */
631 /* Warning: since we have an exponent decrease, when
632 p = 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1 and d = 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS, the round bit
633 corresponds to the upper bit of -c. In that case rb = 0 and
634 sb = 1, except when c = 1000...000 where rb = 1 and sb = 0. */
635 rb = sh > 1 || d > 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS
636 || (cp[1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && cp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO);
637 /* sb=1 below is incorrect when p = 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1,
638 d = 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS and c = 1000...000, but in
639 that case the even rule wound round up too. */
640 ap[0] = ~mask;
641 ap[1] = MPFR_LIMB_MAX;
642 bx --;
643 }
644 else
645 {
646 ap[0] = a0;
647 ap[1] = a1;
648 rb = 1;
649 }
650 sb = 1;
651 }
652 }
653 else /* cx > bx */
654 {
655 mpfr_exp_t tx;
656 mp_limb_t *tp;
657 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
658 tp = bp; bp = cp; cp = tp;
659 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a, b);
660 goto BGreater2;
661 }
662
663 /* now perform rounding */
664
665 /* Warning: MPFR considers underflow *after* rounding with an unbounded
666 exponent range. However since b and c have same precision p, they are
667 multiples of 2^(emin-p), likewise for b-c. Thus if bx < emin, the
668 subtraction (with an unbounded exponent range) is exact, so that bx is
669 also the exponent after rounding with an unbounded exponent range. */
670 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx < __gmpfr_emin))
671 {
672 /* for RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |a|<=2^(emin-2)
673 we have to change to RNDZ */
674 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
675 (bx < __gmpfr_emin - 1 ||
676 (ap[1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && ap[0] == 0)))
677 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
678 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
679 }
680
681 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
682 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
683 MPFR_RET (0);
684 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
685 {
686 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
687 goto truncate;
688 else
689 goto add_one_ulp;
690 }
691 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
692 {
693 truncate:
694 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(a));
695 }
696 else /* round away from zero */
697 {
698 add_one_ulp:
699 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
700 ap[1] += (ap[0] == 0);
701 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[1] == 0))
702 {
703 ap[1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
704 /* Note: bx+1 cannot exceed __gmpfr_emax, since |a| <= |b|, thus
705 bx+1 is at most equal to the original exponent of b. */
706 MPFR_ASSERTD(bx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
707 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx + 1);
708 }
709 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(a));
710 }
711}
712
713/* special code for 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS < p < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
714static int
715mpfr_sub1sp3 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode,
716 mpfr_prec_t p)
717{
718 mpfr_exp_t bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
719 mpfr_exp_t cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
720 mp_limb_t *ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
721 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
722 mp_limb_t *cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
723 mpfr_prec_t cnt, INITIALIZED(sh);
724 mp_limb_t rb; /* round bit */
725 mp_limb_t sb; /* sticky bit */
726 mp_limb_t mask, a0, a1, a2;
727 mpfr_uexp_t d;
728
729 MPFR_ASSERTD(2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS < p && p < 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS);
730
731 if (bx == cx) /* subtraction is exact in this case */
732 {
733 a0 = bp[0] - cp[0];
734 a1 = bp[1] - cp[1] - (bp[0] < cp[0]);
735 /* a borrow is generated for a when either bp[1] < cp[1],
736 or bp[1] = cp[1] and bp[0] < cp[0] */
737 a2 = bp[2] - cp[2]
738 - (bp[1] < cp[1] || (bp[1] == cp[1] && bp[0] < cp[0]));
739 if (a2 == 0 && a1 == 0 && a0 == 0) /* result is zero */
740 {
741 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD)
742 MPFR_SET_NEG(a);
743 else
744 MPFR_SET_POS(a);
745 MPFR_SET_ZERO(a);
746 MPFR_RET (0);
747 }
748 else if (a2 >= bp[2]) /* borrow: |c| > |b| */
749 {
750 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a, b);
751 /* a = b-c mod 2^(3*GMP_NUMB_BITS) */
752 a0 = -a0;
753 a1 = -a1 - (a0 != 0);
754 a2 = -a2 - (a0 != 0 || a1 != 0);
755 }
756 else /* bp[0] > cp[0] */
757 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
758
759 if (a2 == 0)
760 {
761 a2 = a1;
762 a1 = a0;
763 a0 = 0;
764 bx -= GMP_NUMB_BITS;
765 if (a2 == 0)
766 {
767 a2 = a1;
768 a1 = 0;
769 bx -= GMP_NUMB_BITS;
770 }
771 }
772
773 /* now a2 != 0 */
774 MPFR_ASSERTD(a2 != 0);
775 count_leading_zeros (cnt, a2);
776 if (cnt)
777 {
778 ap[2] = (a2 << cnt) | (a1 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
779 ap[1] = (a1 << cnt) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
780 ap[0] = a0 << cnt;
781 bx -= cnt;
782 }
783 else
784 {
785 ap[2] = a2;
786 ap[1] = a1;
787 ap[0] = a0;
788 }
789 rb = sb = 0;
790 /* Note: sh is not initialized, but will not be used in this case. */
791 }
792 else if (bx > cx)
793 {
794 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
795 BGreater2:
796 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
797 sh = 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
798 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
799 if (d < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
800 {
801 mp_limb_t cy;
802 /* warning: we must have the most significant bit of sb correct
803 since it might become the round bit below */
804 sb = cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d); /* neglected part of c */
805 a0 = bp[0] - ((cp[1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | (cp[0] >> d));
806 a1 = bp[1] - ((cp[2] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | (cp[1] >> d))
807 - (a0 > bp[0]);
808 cy = a1 > bp[1] || (a1 == bp[1] && a0 > bp[0]); /* borrow in a1 */
809 a2 = bp[2] - (cp[2] >> d) - cy;
810 /* if sb is non-zero, subtract 1 from a2, a1, a0 since we want a
811 non-negative neglected part */
812 if (sb)
813 {
814 a2 -= (a1 == 0 && a0 == 0);
815 a1 -= (a0 == 0);
816 a0 --;
817 /* a = a2,a1,a0 cannot become zero here, since:
818 a) if d >= 2, then a2 >= 2^(w-1) - (2^(w-2)-1) with
819 w = GMP_NUMB_BITS, thus a2 - 1 >= 2^(w-2),
820 b) if d = 1, then since p < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS we have sb=0. */
821 MPFR_ASSERTD(a2 > 0 || a1 > 0 || a0 > 0);
822 sb = -sb; /* 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS - sb */
823 }
824 if (a2 == 0)
825 {
826 /* this implies d=1, which in turn implies sb=0 */
827 MPFR_ASSERTD(sb == 0);
828 a2 = a1;
829 a1 = a0;
830 a0 = 0; /* should be a0 = sb */
831 /* since sb=0 already, no need to set it to 0 */
832 bx -= GMP_NUMB_BITS;
833 if (a2 == 0)
834 {
835 a2 = a1;
836 a1 = 0; /* should be a1 = a0 */
837 bx -= GMP_NUMB_BITS;
838 }
839 }
840 /* now a1 != 0 */
841 MPFR_ASSERTD(a2 != 0);
842 count_leading_zeros (cnt, a2);
843 if (cnt)
844 {
845 ap[2] = (a2 << cnt) | (a1 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
846 ap[1] = (a1 << cnt) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
847 a0 = (a0 << cnt) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - cnt));
848 sb <<= cnt;
849 bx -= cnt;
850 }
851 else
852 {
853 ap[2] = a2;
854 ap[1] = a1;
855 }
856 /* sh > 0 since p < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
857 MPFR_ASSERTD(sh > 0);
858 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
859 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
860 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
861 }
862 else if (d < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
863 {
864 mp_limb_t c0shifted;
865 /* warning: we must have the most significant bit of sb correct
866 since it might become the round bit below */
867 sb = (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS) ? cp[0]
868 : (cp[1] << (2*GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | (cp[0] != 0);
869 c0shifted = (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS) ? cp[1]
870 : (cp[2] << (2*GMP_NUMB_BITS-d)) | (cp[1] >> (d - GMP_NUMB_BITS));
871 a0 = bp[0] - c0shifted;
872 /* TODO: add a non-regression test for cp[2] == MPFR_LIMB_MAX,
873 d == GMP_NUMB_BITS and a0 > bp[0]. */
874 a1 = bp[1] - (cp[2] >> (d - GMP_NUMB_BITS)) - (a0 > bp[0]);
875 a2 = bp[2] - (a1 > bp[1] || (a1 == bp[1] && a0 > bp[0]));
876 /* if sb is non-zero, subtract 1 from a2, a1, a0 since we want a
877 non-negative neglected part */
878 if (sb)
879 {
880 a2 -= (a1 == 0 && a0 == 0);
881 a1 -= (a0 == 0);
882 a0 --;
883 /* a = a2,a1,a0 cannot become zero here, since:
884 a) if d >= 2, then a2 >= 2^(w-1) - (2^(w-2)-1) with
885 w = GMP_NUMB_BITS, thus a2 - 1 >= 2^(w-2),
886 b) if d = 1, then since p < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS we have sb=0. */
887 MPFR_ASSERTD(a2 > 0 || a1 > 0 || a0 > 0);
888 sb = -sb; /* 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS - sb */
889 }
890 /* since bp[2] has its most significant bit set, we can have an
891 exponent decrease of at most one */
892 if (a2 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
893 {
894 ap[2] = (a2 << 1) | (a1 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
895 ap[1] = (a1 << 1) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
896 a0 = (a0 << 1) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
897 sb <<= 1;
898 bx --;
899 }
900 else
901 {
902 ap[2] = a2;
903 ap[1] = a1;
904 }
905 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
906 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
907 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
908 }
909 else if (d < 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS<=d<3*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
910 {
911 MPFR_ASSERTD (2*GMP_NUMB_BITS <= d && d < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS);
912 /* warning: we must have the most significant bit of sb correct
913 since it might become the round bit below */
914 if (d == 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
915 sb = cp[1] | (cp[0] != 0);
916 else
917 sb = cp[2] << (3*GMP_NUMB_BITS - d) | (cp[1] != 0) | (cp[0] != 0);
918 sb = -sb;
919 /* TODO: add a non-regression test for cp[2] == MPFR_LIMB_MAX,
920 d == 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS and sb != 0. */
921 a0 = bp[0] - (cp[2] >> (d - 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS)) - (sb != 0);
922 a1 = bp[1] - (a0 > bp[0] || (a0 == bp[0] && sb != 0));
923 a2 = bp[2] - (a1 > bp[1]);
924 if (a2 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
925 {
926 ap[2] = (a2 << 1) | (a1 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
927 ap[1] = (a1 << 1) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
928 a0 = (a0 << 1) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
929 sb <<= 1;
930 bx --;
931 }
932 else
933 {
934 ap[2] = a2;
935 ap[1] = a1;
936 }
937 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
938 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
939 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
940 }
941 else /* d >= 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
942 {
943 /* We compute b - ulp(b), and the remainder ulp(b) - c satisfies:
944 1/2 ulp(b) < ulp(b) - c < ulp(b), thus rb = sb = 1. */
945 mp_limb_t t = MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
946 a0 = bp[0] - t;
947 a1 = bp[1] - (bp[0] < t);
948 a2 = bp[2] - (a1 > bp[1]);
949 if (a2 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
950 {
951 /* necessarily we had b = 1000...000 */
952 /* Warning: since we have an exponent decrease, when
953 p = 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1 and d = 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS, the round bit
954 corresponds to the upper bit of -c. In that case rb = 0 and
955 sb = 1, except when c = 1000...000 where rb = 1 and sb = 0. */
956 rb = sh > 1 || d > 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS
957 || (cp[2] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && cp[1] == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO &&
958 cp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO);
959 /* sb=1 below is incorrect when p = 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1,
960 d = 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS and c = 1000...000, but in
961 that case the even rule wound round up too. */
962 ap[0] = ~mask;
963 ap[1] = MPFR_LIMB_MAX;
964 ap[2] = MPFR_LIMB_MAX;
965 bx --;
966 }
967 else
968 {
969 ap[0] = a0;
970 ap[1] = a1;
971 ap[2] = a2;
972 rb = 1;
973 }
974 sb = 1;
975 }
976 }
977 else /* cx > bx */
978 {
979 mpfr_exp_t tx;
980 mp_limb_t *tp;
981 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
982 tp = bp; bp = cp; cp = tp;
983 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a, b);
984 goto BGreater2;
985 }
986
987 /* now perform rounding */
988
989 /* Warning: MPFR considers underflow *after* rounding with an unbounded
990 exponent range. However since b and c have same precision p, they are
991 multiples of 2^(emin-p), likewise for b-c. Thus if bx < emin, the
992 subtraction (with an unbounded exponent range) is exact, so that bx is
993 also the exponent after rounding with an unbounded exponent range. */
994 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx < __gmpfr_emin))
995 {
996 /* for RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |a|<=2^(emin-2)
997 we have to change to RNDZ */
998 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
999 (bx < __gmpfr_emin - 1 ||
1000 (ap[2] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && ap[1] == 0 && ap[0] == 0)))
1001 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
1002 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
1003 }
1004
1005 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
1006 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
1007 MPFR_RET (0);
1008 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
1009 {
1010 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
1011 goto truncate;
1012 else
1013 goto add_one_ulp;
1014 }
1015 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
1016 {
1017 truncate:
1018 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(a));
1019 }
1020 else /* round away from zero */
1021 {
1022 add_one_ulp:
1023 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
1024 ap[1] += (ap[0] == 0);
1025 ap[2] += (ap[1] == 0 && ap[0] == 0);
1026 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[2] == 0))
1027 {
1028 ap[2] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
1029 /* Note: bx+1 cannot exceed __gmpfr_emax, since |a| <= |b|, thus
1030 bx+1 is at most equal to the original exponent of b. */
1031 MPFR_ASSERTD(bx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
1032 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx + 1);
1033 }
1034 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(a));
1035 }
1036}
1037
1038#endif /* !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) */
1039
1040/* Rounding Sub */
1041
1042/*
1043 compute sgn(b)*(|b| - |c|) if |b|>|c| else -sgn(b)*(|c| -|b|)
1044 Returns 0 iff result is exact,
1045 a negative value when the result is less than the exact value,
1046 a positive value otherwise.
1047*/
1048
1049/* A0...Ap-1
1050 * Cp Cp+1 ....
1051 * <- C'p+1 ->
1052 * Cp = -1 if calculated from c mantissa
1053 * Cp = 0 if 0 from a or c
1054 * Cp = 1 if calculated from a.
1055 * C'p+1 = First bit not null or 0 if there isn't one
1056 *
1057 * Can't have Cp=-1 and C'p+1=1*/
1058
1059/* RND = MPFR_RNDZ:
1060 * + if Cp=0 and C'p+1=0,1, Truncate.
1061 * + if Cp=0 and C'p+1=-1, SubOneUlp
1062 * + if Cp=-1, SubOneUlp
1063 * + if Cp=1, AddOneUlp
1064 * RND = MPFR_RNDA (Away)
1065 * + if Cp=0 and C'p+1=0,-1, Truncate
1066 * + if Cp=0 and C'p+1=1, AddOneUlp
1067 * + if Cp=1, AddOneUlp
1068 * + if Cp=-1, Truncate
1069 * RND = MPFR_RNDN
1070 * + if Cp=0, Truncate
1071 * + if Cp=1 and C'p+1=1, AddOneUlp
1072 * + if Cp=1 and C'p+1=-1, Truncate
1073 * + if Cp=1 and C'p+1=0, Truncate if Ap-1=0, AddOneUlp else
1074 * + if Cp=-1 and C'p+1=-1, SubOneUlp
1075 * + if Cp=-1 and C'p+1=0, Truncate if Ap-1=0, SubOneUlp else
1076 *
1077 * If AddOneUlp:
1078 * If carry, then it is 11111111111 + 1 = 10000000000000
1079 * ap[n-1]=MPFR_HIGHT_BIT
1080 * If SubOneUlp:
1081 * If we lose one bit, it is 1000000000 - 1 = 0111111111111
1082 * Then shift, and put as last bit x which is calculated
1083 * according Cp, Cp-1 and rnd_mode.
1084 * If Truncate,
1085 * If it is a power of 2,
1086 * we may have to suboneulp in some special cases.
1087 *
1088 * To simplify, we don't use Cp = 1.
1089 *
1090 */
1091
1092MPFR_HOT_FUNCTION_ATTR int
1093mpfr_sub1sp (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
1094{
1095 mpfr_exp_t bx, cx;
1096 mpfr_uexp_t d;
1097 mpfr_prec_t p, sh, cnt;
1098 mp_size_t n;
1099 mp_limb_t *ap, *bp, *cp;
1100 mp_limb_t limb;
1101 int inexact;
1102 mp_limb_t bcp,bcp1; /* Cp and C'p+1 */
1103 mp_limb_t bbcp = MPFR_LIMB_MAX, bbcp1 = MPFR_LIMB_MAX; /* Cp+1 and C'p+2,
1104 gcc claims that they might be used uninitialized. We fill them with invalid
1105 values, which should produce a failure if so. See README.dev file. */
1106
1107 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
1108
1109 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(a) == MPFR_PREC(b) && MPFR_PREC(b) == MPFR_PREC(c));
1110 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_PURE_FP(b));
1111 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_PURE_FP(c));
1112
1113 /* Read prec and num of limbs */
1114 p = MPFR_GET_PREC (b);
1115
1116#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI)
1117 /* special case for p < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
1118 if (p < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
1119 return mpfr_sub1sp1 (a, b, c, rnd_mode, p);
1120
1121 /* special case for GMP_NUMB_BITS < p < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
1122 if (GMP_NUMB_BITS < p && p < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
1123 return mpfr_sub1sp2 (a, b, c, rnd_mode, p);
1124
1125 /* special case for p = GMP_NUMB_BITS: we put it *after* mpfr_sub1sp2,
1126 in order not to slow down mpfr_sub1sp2, which should be more frequent */
1127 if (p == GMP_NUMB_BITS)
1128 return mpfr_sub1sp1n (a, b, c, rnd_mode);
1129
1130 /* special case for 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS < p < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
1131 if (2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS < p && p < 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
1132 return mpfr_sub1sp3 (a, b, c, rnd_mode, p);
1133#endif
1134
1135 n = MPFR_PREC2LIMBS (p);
1136 /* Fast cmp of |b| and |c| */
1137 bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
1138 cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
1139
1140 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
1141
1142 if (bx == cx)
1143 {
1144 mp_size_t k = n - 1;
1145 /* Check mantissa since exponents are equal */
1146 bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
1147 cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
1148 while (k >= 0 && MPFR_UNLIKELY(bp[k] == cp[k]))
1149 k--;
1150 if (k < 0)
1151 /* b == c ! */
1152 {
1153 /* Return exact number 0 */
1154 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD)
1155 MPFR_SET_NEG(a);
1156 else
1157 MPFR_SET_POS(a);
1158 MPFR_SET_ZERO(a);
1159 MPFR_RET(0);
1160 }
1161 else if (bp[k] > cp[k])
1162 goto BGreater;
1163 else
1164 {
1165 MPFR_ASSERTD(bp[k] < cp[k]);
1166 goto CGreater;
1167 }
1168 }
1169 else if (bx < cx)
1170 {
1171 /* Swap b and c and set sign */
1172 mpfr_srcptr t;
1173 mpfr_exp_t tx;
1174 CGreater:
1175 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN(a,b);
1176 t = b; b = c; c = t;
1177 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
1178 }
1179 else
1180 {
1181 /* |b| > |c| */
1182 BGreater:
1183 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN(a,b);
1184 }
1185
1186 /* Now |b| > |c| */
1187 MPFR_ASSERTD(bx >= cx);
1188 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
1189 /* printf ("New with diff=%lu\n", (unsigned long) d); */
1190
1191 if (d <= 1)
1192 {
1193 if (d == 0)
1194 {
1195 /* <-- b -->
1196 <-- c --> : exact sub */
1197 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
1198 mpn_sub_n (ap, MPFR_MANT(b), MPFR_MANT(c), n);
1199 /* Normalize */
1200 ExactNormalize:
1201 limb = ap[n-1];
1202 if (MPFR_LIKELY (limb != 0))
1203 {
1204 /* First limb is not zero. */
1205 count_leading_zeros(cnt, limb);
1206 /* cnt could be == 0 <= SubD1Lose */
1207 if (MPFR_LIKELY(cnt))
1208 {
1209 mpn_lshift(ap, ap, n, cnt); /* Normalize number */
1210 bx -= cnt; /* Update final expo */
1211 }
1212 /* Last limb should be OK */
1213 MPFR_ASSERTD(!(ap[0] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK((unsigned int) (-p)
1214 % GMP_NUMB_BITS)));
1215 }
1216 else
1217 {
1218 /* First limb is zero */
1219 mp_size_t k = n-1, len;
1220 /* Find the first limb not equal to zero. It necessarily exists
1221 since |b| > |c|. */
1222 do
1223 {
1224 MPFR_ASSERTD( k > 0 );
1225 limb = ap[--k];
1226 }
1227 while (limb == 0);
1228 MPFR_ASSERTD(limb != 0);
1229 count_leading_zeros(cnt, limb);
1230 k++;
1231 len = n - k; /* Number of last limb */
1232 MPFR_ASSERTD(k >= 0);
1233 if (cnt)
1234 mpn_lshift (ap + len, ap, k, cnt); /* Normalize the High Limb*/
1235 else
1236 {
1237 /* Must use copyd since src and dst may overlap & dst>=src */
1238 mpn_copyd (ap+len, ap, k);
1239 }
1240 MPN_ZERO(ap, len); /* Zeroing the last limbs */
1241 bx -= cnt + len*GMP_NUMB_BITS; /* Update Expo */
1242 /* Last limb should be OK */
1243 MPFR_ASSERTD(!(ap[len] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK((unsigned int) (-p)
1244 % GMP_NUMB_BITS)));
1245 }
1246 /* Check expo underflow */
1247 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx < __gmpfr_emin))
1248 {
1249 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
1250 /* since b and c have same sign, exponent and precision, the
1251 subtraction is exact */
1252 /* printf("(D==0 Underflow)\n"); */
1253 /* for MPFR_RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away from zero,
1254 thus for |a| <= 2^(emin-2) we change to RNDZ. */
1255 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
1256 (bx < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || mpfr_powerof2_raw (a)))
1257 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
1258 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
1259 }
1260 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
1261 /* No rounding is necessary since the result is exact */
1262 MPFR_ASSERTD(ap[n-1] > ~ap[n-1]);
1263 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
1264 return 0;
1265 }
1266 else /* if (d == 1) */
1267 {
1268 /* | <-- b -->
1269 | <-- c --> */
1270 mp_limb_t c0, mask;
1271 mp_size_t k;
1272 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(sh, p);
1273 /* If we lose at least one bit, compute 2*b-c (Exact)
1274 * else compute b-c/2 */
1275 bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
1276 cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
1277 k = n-1;
1278 limb = bp[k] - cp[k]/2;
1279 /* we have |b|-|c| >= limb*W^k - (2*W^k-1)/2 >= limb*W^k - W^k + 1/2
1280 thus if limb > W^k/2, |b|-|c| >= 1/2*W^n.
1281 Moreover if trunc(|c|) represents the first p-1 bits of |c|,
1282 minus the last significant bit called c0 below, then we have
1283 |b|-trunc(|c|) >= 1/2*W^n+1, thus the two mpn_sub_n calls
1284 below necessarily yield a > 1/2*W^n. */
1285 if (limb > MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
1286 {
1287 /* The exponent cannot decrease: compute b-c/2 */
1288 /* Shift c in the allocated temporary block */
1289 SubD1NoLose:
1290 c0 = cp[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh);
1291 mask = ~MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
1292 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
1293 cp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (n);
1294 /* FIXME: it might be faster to have one function shifting c by 1
1295 to the right and adding with b to a, which would read c once
1296 only, and avoid a temporary allocation. */
1297 mpn_rshift (cp, MPFR_MANT(c), n, 1);
1298 cp[0] &= mask; /* Zero last bit of c if set */
1299 mpn_sub_n (ap, bp, cp, n);
1300 MPFR_SET_EXP(a, bx); /* No expo overflow! */
1301 MPFR_ASSERTD(ap[n-1] > ~ap[n-1]);
1302 if (MPFR_LIKELY(c0 == 0))
1303 {
1304 /* Result is exact: no need of rounding! */
1305 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
1306 return 0;
1307 }
1308 MPFR_ASSERTD( !(ap[0] & ~mask) ); /* Check last bits */
1309 /* No normalize is needed */
1310 /* Rounding is necessary since c0 = 1 */
1311 /* Cp =-1 and C'p+1=0 */
1312 bcp = 1; bcp1 = 0;
1313
1314 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
1315 goto truncate; /* low(b) = 0 and low(c) is 0 or 1/2 ulp(b), thus
1316 low(b) - low(c) = 0 or -1/2 ulp(b) */
1317 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
1318 {
1319 /* Even Rule apply: Check last bit of a. */
1320 if (MPFR_LIKELY( (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0) )
1321 goto truncate;
1322 else
1323 goto sub_one_ulp;
1324 }
1325 MPFR_UPDATE_RND_MODE(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a));
1326 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ)
1327 goto sub_one_ulp;
1328 else
1329 goto truncate;
1330 }
1331 else if (MPFR_LIKELY(limb < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
1332 {
1333 /* |b| - |c| <= (W/2-1)*W^k + W^k-1 = 1/2*W^n - 1 */
1334 /* The exponent decreases by one. */
1335 SubD1Lose:
1336 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
1337 /* Compute 2*b-c (Exact) */
1338 /* Experiments with __gmpn_rsblsh_n show that it is not always
1339 faster than mpn_lshift + mpn_sub_n, thus we don't enable it
1340 for now (HAVE___GMPN_RSBLSH_N -> HAVE___GMPN_RSBLSH_Nxxx). */
1341#if defined(WANT_GMP_INTERNALS) && defined(HAVE___GMPN_RSBLSH_Nxxx)
1342 /* {ap, n} = 2*{bp, n} - {cp, n} */
1343 __gmpn_rsblsh_n (ap, MPFR_MANT(c), MPFR_MANT(b), n, 1);
1344#else
1345 bp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (n);
1346 /* Shift b in the allocated temporary block */
1347 mpn_lshift (bp, MPFR_MANT(b), n, 1);
1348 mpn_sub_n (ap, bp, cp, n);
1349#endif
1350 bx--;
1351 goto ExactNormalize;
1352 }
1353 else
1354 {
1355 /* Case: limb = 100000000000 */
1356 /* Check while b[k] == c'[k] (C' is C shifted by 1) */
1357 /* If b[k]<c'[k] => We lose at least one bit*/
1358 /* If b[k]>c'[k] => We don't lose any bit */
1359 /* If k==-1 => We don't lose any bit
1360 AND the result is 100000000000 0000000000 00000000000 */
1361 mp_limb_t carry;
1362 do
1363 {
1364 carry = cp[k] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1);
1365 if (--k < 0)
1366 break;
1367 carry += cp[k] >> 1;
1368 }
1369 while (bp[k] == carry);
1370 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(k < 0))
1371 {
1372 ap = MPFR_MANT (a);
1373 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(carry))
1374 {
1375 /* If carry then necessarily the precision is an exact
1376 multiple of GMP_NUMB_BITS, and we lose one bit,
1377 thus the (exact) result is a power of 2 minus 1. */
1378 memset (ap, -1, n * MPFR_BYTES_PER_MP_LIMB);
1379 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx - 1);
1380 /* No underflow is possible since cx = bx-1 is a valid
1381 exponent. */
1382 }
1383 else
1384 {
1385 /* No carry: result is a power of 2. */
1386 MPN_ZERO (ap, n - 1);
1387 ap[n-1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
1388 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx); /* No expo overflow! */
1389 }
1390 /* No Normalize is needed */
1391 /* No Rounding is needed */
1392 MPFR_TMP_FREE (marker);
1393 return 0;
1394 }
1395 /* carry = cp[k]/2+(cp[k-1]&1)<<(GMP_NUMB_BITS-1) = c'[k]*/
1396 else if (bp[k] > carry)
1397 goto SubD1NoLose; /* |b|-|c| >= 1/2*W^n */
1398 else
1399 {
1400 MPFR_ASSERTD(bp[k] < carry);
1401 goto SubD1Lose; /* |b|-|c| <= 1/2*W^n-1 and is exact */
1402 }
1403 }
1404 }
1405 }
1406 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(d >= p)) /* the difference of exponents is larger
1407 than the precision of all operands, thus
1408 the result is either b or b - 1 ulp,
1409 with a possible exact result when
1410 d = p, b = 2^e and c = 1/2 ulp(b) */
1411 {
1412 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
1413 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(sh, p);
1414 /* We can't set A before since we use cp for rounding... */
1415 /* Perform rounding: check if a=b or a=b-ulp(b) */
1416 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(d == p))
1417 {
1418 /* cp == -1 and c'p+1 = ? */
1419 bcp = 1;
1420 /* We need Cp+1 later for a very improbable case. */
1421 bbcp = (MPFR_MANT(c)[n-1] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<(GMP_NUMB_BITS-2)));
1422 /* We need also C'p+1 for an even more unprobable case... */
1423 if (MPFR_LIKELY( bbcp ))
1424 bcp1 = 1;
1425 else
1426 {
1427 cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
1428 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(cp[n-1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
1429 {
1430 mp_size_t k = n-1;
1431 do
1432 k--;
1433 while (k >= 0 && cp[k] == 0);
1434 bcp1 = (k >= 0);
1435 }
1436 else
1437 bcp1 = 1;
1438 }
1439 /* printf("(D=P) Cp=-1 Cp+1=%d C'p+1=%d \n", bbcp!=0, bcp1!=0); */
1440 bp = MPFR_MANT (b);
1441
1442 /* Even if src and dest overlap, it is OK using MPN_COPY */
1443 if (MPFR_LIKELY(rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF))
1444 /* then d = p, and subtracting one ulp of b is ok even in the
1445 exact case b = 2^e and c = 1/2 ulp(b) */
1446 {
1447 MPN_COPY(ap, bp, n);
1448 goto sub_one_ulp;
1449 }
1450 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
1451 {
1452 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (bcp != 0 && bcp1 == 0))
1453 /* Cp=-1 and C'p+1=0: Even rule Apply! */
1454 /* Check Ap-1 = Bp-1 */
1455 if ((bp[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0)
1456 {
1457 MPN_COPY(ap, bp, n);
1458 goto truncate;
1459 }
1460 MPN_COPY(ap, bp, n);
1461 goto sub_one_ulp;
1462 }
1463 MPFR_UPDATE_RND_MODE(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a));
1464 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ)
1465 {
1466 MPN_COPY(ap, bp, n);
1467 goto sub_one_ulp;
1468 }
1469 else
1470 {
1471 MPN_COPY(ap, bp, n);
1472 goto truncate;
1473 }
1474 }
1475 else
1476 {
1477 /* Cp=0, Cp+1=-1 if d==p+1, C'p+1=-1 */
1478 bcp = 0; bbcp = (d==p+1); bcp1 = 1;
1479 /* printf("(D>P) Cp=%d Cp+1=%d C'p+1=%d\n", bcp!=0,bbcp!=0,bcp1!=0); */
1480 /* Need to compute C'p+2 if d==p+1 and if rnd_mode=NEAREST
1481 (Because of a very improbable case) */
1482 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(d==p+1 && rnd_mode==MPFR_RNDN))
1483 {
1484 cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
1485 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(cp[n-1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
1486 {
1487 mp_size_t k = n-1;
1488 do
1489 k--;
1490 while (k >= 0 && cp[k] == 0);
1491 bbcp1 = (k >= 0);
1492 }
1493 else
1494 bbcp1 = 1;
1495 /* printf("(D>P) C'p+2=%d\n", bbcp1!=0); */
1496 }
1497 /* Copy mantissa B in A */
1498 MPN_COPY(ap, MPFR_MANT(b), n);
1499 /* Round */
1500 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
1501 goto truncate;
1502 MPFR_UPDATE_RND_MODE(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a));
1503 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ)
1504 goto sub_one_ulp;
1505 else /* rnd_mode = AWAY */
1506 goto truncate;
1507 }
1508 }
1509 else /* case 2 <= d < p */
1510 {
1511 mpfr_uexp_t dm;
1512 mp_size_t m;
1513 mp_limb_t mask;
1514
1515 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(sh, p);
1516 cp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (n);
1517
1518 /* Shift c in temporary allocated place */
1519 dm = d % GMP_NUMB_BITS;
1520 m = d / GMP_NUMB_BITS;
1521 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(dm == 0))
1522 {
1523 /* dm = 0 and m > 0: Just copy */
1524 MPFR_ASSERTD(m != 0);
1525 MPN_COPY(cp, MPFR_MANT(c)+m, n-m);
1526 MPN_ZERO(cp+n-m, m);
1527 }
1528 else if (MPFR_LIKELY(m == 0))
1529 {
1530 /* dm >=2 and m == 0: just shift */
1531 MPFR_ASSERTD(dm >= 2);
1532 mpn_rshift(cp, MPFR_MANT(c), n, dm);
1533 }
1534 else
1535 {
1536 /* dm > 0 and m > 0: shift and zero */
1537 mpn_rshift(cp, MPFR_MANT(c)+m, n-m, dm);
1538 MPN_ZERO(cp+n-m, m);
1539 }
1540
1541 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("Before", MPFR_MANT(c), p); */
1542 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("B= ", MPFR_MANT(b), p); */
1543 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("After ", cp, p); */
1544
1545 /* Compute bcp=Cp and bcp1=C'p+1 */
1546 if (MPFR_LIKELY(sh))
1547 {
1548 /* Try to compute them from C' rather than C (FIXME: Faster?) */
1549 bcp = (cp[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<(sh-1))) ;
1550 if (cp[0] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh-1))
1551 bcp1 = 1;
1552 else
1553 {
1554 /* We can't compute C'p+1 from C'. Compute it from C */
1555 /* Start from bit x=p-d+sh in mantissa C
1556 (+sh since we have already looked sh bits in C'!) */
1557 mpfr_prec_t x = p-d+sh-1;
1558 if (x > p)
1559 /* We are already looked at all the bits of c, so C'p+1 = 0*/
1560 bcp1 = 0;
1561 else
1562 {
1563 mp_limb_t *tp = MPFR_MANT(c);
1564 mp_size_t kx = n-1 - (x / GMP_NUMB_BITS);
1565 mpfr_prec_t sx = GMP_NUMB_BITS-1-(x%GMP_NUMB_BITS);
1566 /* printf ("(First) x=%lu Kx=%ld Sx=%lu\n",
1567 (unsigned long) x, (long) kx, (unsigned long) sx); */
1568 /* Looks at the last bits of limb kx (if sx=0 does nothing)*/
1569 if (tp[kx] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sx))
1570 bcp1 = 1;
1571 else
1572 {
1573 /*kx += (sx==0);*/
1574 /*If sx==0, tp[kx] hasn't been checked*/
1575 do
1576 kx--;
1577 while (kx >= 0 && tp[kx] == 0);
1578 bcp1 = (kx >= 0);
1579 }
1580 }
1581 }
1582 }
1583 else
1584 {
1585 /* Compute Cp and C'p+1 from C with sh=0 */
1586 mp_limb_t *tp = MPFR_MANT(c);
1587 /* Start from bit x=p-d in mantissa C */
1588 mpfr_prec_t x = p-d;
1589 mp_size_t kx = n-1 - (x / GMP_NUMB_BITS);
1590 mpfr_prec_t sx = GMP_NUMB_BITS-1-(x%GMP_NUMB_BITS);
1591 MPFR_ASSERTD(p >= d);
1592 bcp = (tp[kx] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<sx));
1593 /* Looks at the last bits of limb kx (If sx=0, does nothing)*/
1594 if (tp[kx] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sx))
1595 bcp1 = 1;
1596 else
1597 {
1598 /*kx += (sx==0);*/ /*If sx==0, tp[kx] hasn't been checked*/
1599 do
1600 kx--;
1601 while (kx >= 0 && tp[kx] == 0);
1602 bcp1 = (kx >= 0);
1603 }
1604 }
1605 /* printf("sh=%lu Cp=%d C'p+1=%d\n", sh, bcp!=0, bcp1!=0); */
1606
1607 /* Check if we can lose a bit, and if so compute Cp+1 and C'p+2 */
1608 bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
1609 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (bp[n-1] - cp[n-1] <= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
1610 {
1611 /* We can lose a bit so we precompute Cp+1 and C'p+2 */
1612 /* Test for trivial case: since C'p+1=0, Cp+1=0 and C'p+2 =0 */
1613 if (MPFR_LIKELY(bcp1 == 0))
1614 {
1615 bbcp = 0;
1616 bbcp1 = 0;
1617 }
1618 else /* bcp1 != 0 */
1619 {
1620 /* We can lose a bit:
1621 compute Cp+1 and C'p+2 from mantissa C */
1622 mp_limb_t *tp = MPFR_MANT(c);
1623 /* Start from bit x=(p+1)-d in mantissa C */
1624 mpfr_prec_t x = p+1-d;
1625 mp_size_t kx = n-1 - (x / GMP_NUMB_BITS);
1626 mpfr_prec_t sx = GMP_NUMB_BITS-1 - (x % GMP_NUMB_BITS);
1627
1628 MPFR_ASSERTD(p > d);
1629 /* printf ("(pre) x=%lu Kx=%ld Sx=%lu\n",
1630 (unsigned long) x, (long) kx, (unsigned long) sx); */
1631 bbcp = (tp[kx] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<sx)) ;
1632 /* Looks at the last bits of limb kx (If sx=0, does nothing)*/
1633 /* If Cp+1=0, since C'p+1!=0, C'p+2=1 ! */
1634 if (MPFR_LIKELY (bbcp == 0 || (tp[kx] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sx))))
1635 bbcp1 = 1;
1636 else
1637 {
1638 /*kx += (sx==0);*/ /*If sx==0, tp[kx] hasn't been checked*/
1639 do
1640 kx--;
1641 while (kx >= 0 && tp[kx] == 0);
1642 bbcp1 = (kx >= 0);
1643 /* printf ("(Pre) Scan done for %ld\n", (long) kx); */
1644 }
1645 } /*End of Bcp1 != 0*/
1646 /* printf("(Pre) Cp+1=%d C'p+2=%d\n", bbcp!=0, bbcp1!=0); */
1647 } /* End of "can lose a bit" */
1648
1649 /* Clean shifted C' */
1650 mask = ~MPFR_LIMB_MASK (sh);
1651 cp[0] &= mask;
1652
1653 /* Subtract the mantissa c from b in a */
1654 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
1655 mpn_sub_n (ap, bp, cp, n);
1656 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("Sub= ", ap, p); */
1657
1658 /* Normalize: we lose at max one bit*/
1659 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(MPFR_LIMB_MSB(ap[n-1]) == 0))
1660 {
1661 /* High bit is not set and we have to fix it! */
1662 /* Ap >= 010000xxx001 */
1663 mpn_lshift(ap, ap, n, 1);
1664 /* Ap >= 100000xxx010 */
1665 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bcp != 0)) /* Check if Cp = -1 */
1666 /* Since Cp == -1, we have to subtract one more */
1667 {
1668 mpn_sub_1(ap, ap, n, MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<sh);
1669 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_LIMB_MSB(ap[n-1]) != 0);
1670 }
1671 /* Ap >= 10000xxx001 */
1672 /* Final exponent -1 since we have shifted the mantissa */
1673 bx--;
1674 /* Update bcp and bcp1 */
1675 MPFR_ASSERTD(bbcp != MPFR_LIMB_MAX);
1676 MPFR_ASSERTD(bbcp1 != MPFR_LIMB_MAX);
1677 bcp = bbcp;
1678 bcp1 = bbcp1;
1679 /* We don't have anymore a valid Cp+1!
1680 But since Ap >= 100000xxx001, the final sub can't unnormalize!*/
1681 }
1682 MPFR_ASSERTD( !(ap[0] & ~mask) );
1683
1684 /* Rounding */
1685 if (MPFR_LIKELY(rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF))
1686 goto truncate;
1687 else if (MPFR_LIKELY(rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN))
1688 {
1689 if (MPFR_LIKELY(bcp == 0))
1690 goto truncate;
1691 else if (bcp1 != 0 || (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) != 0)
1692 goto sub_one_ulp;
1693 else
1694 goto truncate;
1695 }
1696
1697 /* Update rounding mode */
1698 MPFR_UPDATE_RND_MODE(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a));
1699 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ && MPFR_LIKELY (bcp != 0 || bcp1 != 0))
1700 goto sub_one_ulp;
1701 goto truncate;
1702 }
1703 MPFR_RET_NEVER_GO_HERE ();
1704
1705 /* Sub one ulp to the result */
1706 sub_one_ulp:
1707 mpn_sub_1 (ap, ap, n, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh);
1708 /* Result should be smaller than exact value: inexact=-1 */
1709 inexact = -1;
1710 /* Check normalization */
1711 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[n-1] < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
1712 {
1713 /* ap was a power of 2, and we lose a bit */
1714 /* Now it is 0111111111111111111[00000 */
1715 /* The following 2 lines are equivalent to: mpn_lshift(ap, ap, n, 1); */
1716 ap[0] <<= 1;
1717 ap[n-1] |= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
1718 bx--;
1719 /* And the lost bit x depends on Cp+1, and Cp */
1720 /* Compute Cp+1 if it isn't already computed (ie d==1) */
1721 /* Note: we can't have d = 1 here, since the only "goto sub_one_ulp"
1722 for d = 1 are in the "SubD1NoLose" case, and in that case
1723 |b|-|c| >= 1/2*W^n, thus round(|b|-|c|) >= 1/2*W^n, and ap[n-1]
1724 cannot go below MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT. */
1725 /* printf("(SubOneUlp)Cp=%d, Cp+1=%d C'p+1=%d\n", bcp!=0,bbcp!=0,bcp1!=0); */
1726 /* Compute the last bit (Since we have shifted the mantissa)
1727 we need one more bit! */
1728 MPFR_ASSERTD(bbcp != MPFR_LIMB_MAX);
1729 if ((rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ && bcp == 0) ||
1730 (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && bbcp == 0) ||
1731 (bcp != 0 && bcp1 == 0)) /* Exact result */
1732 {
1733 ap[0] |= MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
1734 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
1735 inexact = 1;
1736 /* printf("(SubOneUlp) Last bit set\n"); */
1737 }
1738 /* Result could be exact if C'p+1 = 0 and rnd == Zero
1739 since we have had one more bit to the result */
1740 /* Fixme: rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ needed ? */
1741 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ && bcp1 == 0)
1742 {
1743 /* printf("(SubOneUlp) Exact result\n"); */
1744 inexact = 0;
1745 }
1746 }
1747
1748 goto end_of_sub;
1749
1750 truncate:
1751 /* Check if the result is an exact power of 2: 100000000000
1752 in which cases, we could have to do sub_one_ulp due to some nasty reasons:
1753 If Result is a Power of 2:
1754 + If rnd = AWAY,
1755 | If Cp=-1 and C'p+1 = 0, SubOneUlp and the result is EXACT.
1756 If Cp=-1 and C'p+1 =-1, SubOneUlp and the result is above.
1757 Otherwise truncate
1758 + If rnd = NEAREST,
1759 If Cp= 0 and Cp+1 =-1 and C'p+2=-1, SubOneUlp and the result is above
1760 If cp=-1 and C'p+1 = 0, SubOneUlp and the result is exact.
1761 Otherwise truncate.
1762 X bit should always be set if SubOneUlp*/
1763 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[n-1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
1764 {
1765 mp_size_t k = n-1;
1766 do
1767 k--;
1768 while (k >= 0 && ap[k] == 0);
1769 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (k < 0))
1770 {
1771 /* It is a power of 2! */
1772 /* Compute Cp+1 if it isn't already compute (ie d==1) */
1773 /* Note: if d=1, we have {a, n} > 1/2*W^n, thus we cannot have k < 0. */
1774 /* printf("(Truncate) Cp=%d, Cp+1=%d C'p+1=%d C'p+2=%d\n",
1775 bcp!=0, bbcp!=0, bcp1!=0, bbcp1!=0); */
1776 MPFR_ASSERTD(bbcp != MPFR_LIMB_MAX);
1777 MPFR_ASSERTD(rnd_mode != MPFR_RNDN || bcp != 0 ||
1778 bbcp == 0 || bbcp1 != MPFR_LIMB_MAX);
1779 if ((rnd_mode != MPFR_RNDZ && bcp != 0) ||
1780 (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && bcp == 0 && bbcp != 0 && bbcp1 != 0))
1781 {
1782 /* printf("(Truncate) Do sub\n"); */
1783 mpn_sub_1 (ap, ap, n, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh);
1784 ap[n-1] |= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
1785 bx--;
1786 /* FIXME: Explain why it works (or why not)... */
1787 inexact = (bcp1 == 0) ? 0 : (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN) ? -1 : 1;
1788 goto end_of_sub;
1789 }
1790 }
1791 }
1792
1793 /* Calcul of Inexact flag.*/
1794 inexact = (bcp != 0 || bcp1 != 0);
1795
1796 end_of_sub:
1797 /* Update Exponent */
1798 /* bx >= emin. Proof:
1799 If d==0 : Exact case. This is never called.
1800 if 1 < d < p : bx=MPFR_EXP(b) or MPFR_EXP(b)-1 > MPFR_EXP(c) > emin
1801 if d == 1 : bx=MPFR_EXP(b). If we could lose any bits, the exact
1802 normalization is called.
1803 if d >= p : bx=MPFR_EXP(b) >= MPFR_EXP(c) + p > emin
1804 After SubOneUlp, we could have one bit less.
1805 if 1 < d < p : bx >= MPFR_EXP(b)-2 >= MPFR_EXP(c) > emin
1806 if d == 1 : bx >= MPFR_EXP(b)-1 = MPFR_EXP(c) > emin.
1807 if d >= p : bx >= MPFR_EXP(b)-1 > emin since p>=2.
1808 */
1809 MPFR_ASSERTD( bx >= __gmpfr_emin);
1810 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
1811
1812 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
1813 MPFR_RET (inexact * MPFR_INT_SIGN (a));
1814}
1815
